sect1.title: Setting Up a Scanner
sect1.para: You can configure a USB or SCSI scanner with &yast;. The sane-backends package contains hardware drivers and other essentials needed to use a scanner. If you own an HP All-In-One device, see , instructions on how to configure a network scanner are available at .

procedure.title: Configuring a USB or SCSI Scanner

step.para: Connect your USB or SCSI scanner to your computer and turn it on.
Start &yast; and select Hardware Scanner . &yast; builds the scanner database and tries to detect your scanner model automatically.
If a USB or SCSI scanner is not properly detected, try OtherRestart Detection.
To activate the scanner select it from the list of detected scanners and click Edit.
Choose your model form the list and click Next and Finish.
Use OtherTest to make sure you have chosen the correct driver.
Leave the configuration screen with OK.

sect2.title: Configuring an HP All-In-One Device
sect2.para: An HP All-In-One device can be configured with &yast; even if it is made available via the network. If you own a USB HP All-In-One device, start configuring as described in . If it is detected properly and the Test succeeds, it is ready to use.
If your USB device is not properly detected, or your HP All-In-One device is connected to the network, run the HP Device Manager:

step.para: Start &yast; and select Hardware Scanner . &yast; loads the scanner database.

Start the HP Device Manager with Other Run hp-setup and follow the on-screen instructions. After having finished the HP Device Manager, the &yast; scanner module automatically restarts the auto detection.
Leave the configuration screen with OK.

sect2.title: Sharing a Scanner over the Network
sect2.para: &productname; allows the sharing of a scanner over the network. To do so, configure your scanner as follows:

step.para: Configure the scanner as described in .
Enter the host names of the clients (separated by a comma) that should be allowed to use the scanner under Server Settings Permitted Clients for saned and leave the configuration dialog with OK.

sect2.title: Scanning over the Network
sect2.para: To use a scanner that is shared over the network, proceed as follows:

step.para: Open the network scanner configuration menu by Other Scanning via Network .
Enter the host name of the machine the scanner is connected to under Client Settings Servers Used for the net Metadriver
Leave with OK. The network scanner is now listed in the Scanner Configuration window and is ready to use.
